message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.CE, cs.CL

The paper discusses the use of deep reinforcement learning to solve the problem of retrosynthetic planning, which involves making choices regarding chemical reactions to perform in order to synthesize a target molecule from simpler starting materials. This problem is highly combinatorial and uncertain, making it a good fit for the application of machine learning techniques. The paper specifically focuses on the use of self-play to train neural networks to estimate the expected synthesis cost or value of a given molecule, which can then be used to guide the choice of reactions during retrosynthetic planning. Based on this description, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning), as these are the most relevant areas of research for the methods described. Other possible sub-categories include cs.SD (Software Engineering), cs.CE (Computational Engineering), and cs.CL (Computation and Language), as these areas may also be relevant to the development and application of retrosynthetic planning tools.
